title: Employees with zero hours contracts in the UK 2000 to 2019
summary: This line chart has an x axis representing Year and a y axis representing Employees in thousands, with a total of 20 data points. The chart has 5 significant trends.
The longest trend is extremely positive which exists from 2016 to 2010.
Also, the next significant trend is moderately positive which exists from 2008 to 2004.
Similarly, the next significant trend is slightly negative which exists from 2004 to 2000.
On the contrary, the next significant trend is slightly negative which exists from 2019 to 2016.
On the other hand, the next significant trend is moderately positive which exists from 2010 to 2008.
gold: This statistic shows the number of people in thousands on a zero-hour contract in the United Kingdom from 2000 to 2019 . In 2000 , there were 225 thousand people on zero-hour contracts , with this number increasing to approximately 896 thousand by 2019 .
